description: From the Latin curtus (“shortened”). Cognate with Dutch kort, German kurz, Galician curto, French court, Italian corto, Portuguese curto, and Spanish corto. Doublet of short.

entries.meaning: Brief or terse, especially to the point of being rude.

verbs.description: curt (third-person singular simple present curts, present participle curting, simple past and past participle curted)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, rare) To cut, cut short, shorten.
